function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Analysis based on incomplete or biased data may lead to inaccurate conclusions about disease propagation.","Impact":"Misguided decisions and interventions that do not effectively control disease spread.","Mitigation":"Ensure data completeness and representativeness, and validate assumptions through independent sources.","Technologies":"Data validation tools, statistical validation methods, independent verification techniques.","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, researchers, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Data analysts, public health organizations, research institutions."},{"Description":"Misinterpretation of causal relationships due to assumption validation through limited time frames and specific contexts.","Impact":"Implementation of ineffective measures and interventions based on flawed assumptions.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive analysis across diverse time frames and contexts, and validate assumptions through alternative approaches.","Technologies":"Time-series analysis, event studies, causal inference methods, cross-validation techniques.","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, researchers, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Data analysts, public health organizations, research institutions."},{"Description":"Inaccurate extrapolation of trends and causal relationships from a specific locality (Peru) to a broader global context.","Impact":"Implementing global policies and interventions based on localized data that may not be representative of the broader population.","Mitigation":"Conduct comparative analysis with data from diverse global regions, and validate assumptions through cross-country studies.","Technologies":"Comparative analysis tools, cross-country data integration, global data repositories.","People":"Global health organizations, policymakers, researchers, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Data analysts, global health organizations, research institutions."}]}
